page.title: 08 ******GOVERNMENT*****
page.content: {Local Government Willington has its own parish council of 10 elected representatives of the parishioners. Elections to the parish council take place every 3 years and from those elected a chairman for each year is chosen. For 1985-86 the Parish Council Chairperson is Mrs. Cooper. The parish council exists in order that the local amenities, playing fields,common land etc, may be maintained and local interests fostered. Willington also forms part of the South Derbyshire District. The local reprsentative on South Derbyshire District Council is Mrs.Bordoli. Each of these councils meet once a month to discuss general business; in addition sub-committees deal with specific areas of business.
